result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Ostricki

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on August 14, 2025 at 08:15 am.

2:03 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Thomas Roley.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to
COUNT 1: Burglary - Building or Dwelling >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers Count 1 for a period of 3 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.1.

DEOJ RH>> 8/14/2025 at 8:15 a.m.

Bond continues.

ADJ: 2:18 p.m.

2:07p.m.
Clerk Micki.     
State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Thomas Roley.
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

Next Hearing >> 
JPTC/TPD - 8/30/22 at 2:00p.m.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person w/Attorney Thomas Roley
DATES:

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): J.E. or co-defendant(s): D.A.Z.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Must attend high school. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
